1.verse_text: There was a man named Job, living in the land of Uz, who worshipped God and was faithful to him. He was a good man, careful not to do anything evil.
He had seven sons and three daughters,

and owned 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 1,000 head of cattle, and 500 donkeys. He also had a large number of servants and was the richest man in the East. Satan answered, 'I have been walking here and there, roaming round the earth.'
Job's sons used to take it in turns to give a feast, to which all the others would come, and they always invited their three sisters to join them.

The morning after each feast, Job would get up early and offer sacrifices for each of his children in order to purify them. He always did this because he thought that one of them might have sinned by insulting God unintentionally.
When the day came for the heavenly beings to appear before the LORD , Satan was there among them.
The LORD asked him, 'What have you been doing?'
'Did you notice my servant Job?' the LORD asked. 'There is no one on earth as faithful and good as he is. He worships me and is careful not to do anything evil.'
Satan replied, 'Would Job worship you if he got nothing out of it?
You have always protected him and his family and everything he owns. You bless everything he does, and you have given him enough cattle to fill the whole country.
But now suppose you take away everything he has – he will curse you to your face!'
'All right,' the LORD said to Satan, 'everything he has is in your power, but you must not hurt Job himself.' So Satan left.
One day when Job's children were having a feast at the home of their eldest brother,
a messenger came running to Job. 'We were ploughing the fields with the oxen,' he said, 'and the donkeys were in a nearby pasture.
Suddenly the Sabeans attacked and stole them all. They killed every one of your servants except me. I am the only one who escaped to tell you.'
Before he had finished speaking, another servant came and said, 'Lightning struck the sheep and the shepherds and killed them all. I am the only one who escaped to tell you.'

Before he had finished speaking, another servant came and said, 'Three bands of Chaldean raiders attacked us, took away the camels, and killed all your servants except me. I am the only one who escaped to tell you.'
Before he had finished speaking, another servant came and said, 'Your children were having a feast at the home of your eldest son,
when a storm swept in from the desert. It blew the house down and killed them all. I am the only one who escaped to tell you.'
Then Job stood up and tore his clothes in grief. He shaved his head and threw himself face downwards on the ground.
He said, 'I was born with nothing, and I will die with nothing. The LORD gave, and now he has taken away. May his name be praised!'
In spite of everything that had happened, Job did not sin by blaming God.

2.verse_text: When the day came for the heavenly beings to appear before the LORD again, Satan was there among them.
The LORD asked him, 'Where have you been?' Satan answered, 'I have been walking here and there, roaming round the earth.'

'Did you notice my servant Job?' the LORD asked. 'There is no one on earth as faithful and good as he is. He worships me and is careful not to do anything evil. You persuaded me to let you attack him for no reason at all, but Job is still as faithful as ever.'
Satan replied, 'A person will give up everything in order to stay alive.
But now suppose you hurt his body – he will curse you to your face!'
So the LORD said to Satan, 'All right, he is in your power, but you are not to kill him.'
Then Satan left the LORD 's presence and made sores break out all over Job's body.
Job went and sat by the rubbish heap and took a piece of broken pottery to scrape his sores.
His wife said to him, 'You are still as faithful as ever, aren't you? Why don't you curse God and die?'

Job answered, 'You are talking nonsense! When God sends us something good, we welcome it. How can we complain when he sends us trouble?' In spite of everything he suffered, Job said nothing against God.

Three of Job's friends were Eliphaz, from the city of Teman, Bildad, from the land of Shuah, and Zophar, from the land of Naamah. When they heard how much Job had been suffering, they decided to go and comfort him.

While they were still a long way off they saw Job, but did not recognize him. When they did, they began to weep and wail, tearing their clothes in grief and throwing dust into the air and on their heads.
Then they sat there on the ground with him for seven days and nights without saying a word, because they saw how much he was suffering.

3.verse_text: Finally Job broke the silence and cursed the day on which he had been born. put a curse on the night when I was conceived! Never again remember that day; never again let light shine on it. cover it with clouds, and blot out the sun. and never let it be counted again; give that night no hope of dawn. for exposing me to trouble and grief. or died the moment I was born. Why did she feed me at her breast? who rebuilt ancient palaces. who filled their houses with gold and silver, and tired workers find rest at last. free from shouts and harsh commands. and slaves at last are free. Why give light to those in grief? they prefer a grave to any treasure. and hems them in on every side. and I can never stop groaning. and my troubles never end.
Turn that day into darkness, God.
Make it a day of gloom and thick darkness;
Blot that night out of the year,
make it a barren, joyless night.
Tell the sorcerers to curse that day, those who know how to control Leviathan.
Keep the morning star from shining;
Curse that night for letting me be born,
I wish I had died in my mother's womb
Why did my mother hold me on her knees?
If I had died then, I would be at rest now,
sleeping like the kings and rulers
Then I would be sleeping like princes
or sleeping like a stillborn child.
In the grave wicked people stop their evil,
Even prisoners enjoy peace,
Everyone is there, the famous and the unknown,
Why let people go on living in misery?
They wait for death, but it never comes;
They are not happy till they are dead and buried;
God keeps their future hidden
Instead of eating, I mourn,
Everything I fear and dread comes true.
I have no peace, no rest,

4.verse_text: When someone stumbled, weak and tired,
Now it's your turn to be in trouble,
You worshipped God, and your life was blameless;
Think back now. Name a single case
I have seen people plough fields of evil
Like a storm, God destroys them in his anger.
The wicked roar and growl like lions,
Like lions with nothing to kill and eat,
Like a nightmare it disturbed my sleep.
A light breeze touched my face,
I could see something standing there;
'Can anyone be righteous in the sight of God or be pure before his Creator?
God does not trust his heavenly servants;
Do you think he will trust a creature of clay,
Someone may be alive in the morning,
All that he has is taken away;

5.verse_text: Call out, Job. See if anyone answers. Is there any angel to whom you can turn? would be a foolish, senseless thing to do. but I called down a sudden curse on their homes. no one stands up to defend them in court. and thirsty people will envy his wealth. nor does trouble grow out of the ground. and present my case to him. and to his miracles there is no end. and he waters the fields. and gives joy to all who mourn. and traps the wise in their own schemes, so that nothing they do succeeds; he saves the needy from oppression. Do not resent it when he rebukes you. his hand hurts you, and his hand heals. and in war protect you from death. he will save you when destruction comes. and not be afraid of wild animals. wild animals will never attack you. when you look at your sheep, you will find them safe. as there are blades of grass in a pasture. you will live to a ripe old age. It is true, so now accept it.
To worry yourself to death with resentment
I have seen fools who looked secure,
Their children can never find safety;
Hungry people will eat the fool's crops – even the grain growing among thorns – as surely as sparks fly up from a fire.
Evil does not grow in the soil,
No indeed! People bring trouble on themselves,
If I were you, I would turn to God
We cannot understand the great things he does,
He sends rain on the land
Yes, it is God who raises the humble
even at noon they grope in darkness.
But God saves the poor from death;
He gives hope to the poor and silences the wicked.
Happy is the person whom God corrects!
God bandages the wounds he makes;
Time after time he will save you from harm;
when famine comes, he will keep you alive,
God will rescue you from slander;
You will laugh at violence and hunger
The fields you plough will be free of rocks;
Then you will live at peace in your tent;
You will have as many children
Like wheat that ripens till harvest time,
Job, we have learnt this by long study.

6.verse_text: they would weigh more than the sands of the sea,
Almighty God has pierced me with arrows,
A donkey is content when eating grass,
But who can eat tasteless, unsalted food?
I have no appetite for food like that, and everything I eat makes me sick.
Why won't God give me what I ask?
If only he would go ahead and kill me!
If I knew he would, I would leap for joy,
What strength have I got to keep on living?
Am I made of stone? Is my body bronze?
I have no strength left to save myself;
In trouble like this I need loyal friends –
But you, my friends, you deceive me like streams
The streams are choked with snow and ice,
but in the heat they disappear,
Caravans get lost looking for water;
Caravans from Sheba and Tema search,
but their hope dies beside dry streams.
You are like those streams to me,
Have I asked you to give me a gift
or to save me from some enemy or tyrant?
All right, teach me; tell me my faults.
Honest words are convincing,
You think I am talking nothing but wind;
You would even throw dice for orphan slaves
Look me in the face. I won't lie.
You have gone far enough. Stop being unjust.
But you think I am lying –

7.verse_text: Human life is like forced army service, like a life of hard manual labour, like workers waiting for their pay. night after night brings me grief. I toss all night and long for dawn. it is covered with scabs; pus runs out of my sores. my happiness has already ended. If you look for me, I'll be gone. people die and never return; they are forgotten by all who knew them. I am angry and bitter. I have to speak. I look for relief from my pain. you send me visions and nightmares than live in this miserable body. Leave me alone. My life makes no sense. Why pay attention to what they do? and test them every minute. for me to swallow my spittle? Why use me for your target practice? Am I so great a burden to you? Can't you pardon the wrong I do? Soon I will be in my grave, and I'll be gone when you look for me.
like slaves longing for cool shade;
Month after month I have nothing to live for;
When I lie down to sleep, the hours drag;
My body is full of worms;
My days pass by without hope, pass faster than a weaver's shuttle. Do you think I am a sea monster?
Remember, O God, my life is only a breath;
You see me now, but never again.
Why do you keep me under guard?
I lie down and try to rest;
But you – you terrify me with dreams;
until I would rather be strangled
I give up; I am tired of living.
Why are human beings so important to you?
Won't you look away long enough
Are you harmed by my sin, you jailer?
Can't you ever forgive my sin?

8.verse_text: God never twists justice;
Your children must have sinned against God,
But turn now and plead with Almighty God;
if you are so honest and pure,
All the wealth you lost will be nothing
Look for a moment at ancient wisdom;
Our life is short, we know nothing at all;
But let the wise ancestors teach you;
'Reeds can't grow where there is no water;
If the water dries up, they are the first to wither,
Godless men are like those reeds;
They trust a thread – a spider's web.
If they lean on a web, will it hold them up?
The wicked sprout like weeds in the sun,
Their roots wrap round the stones and hold fast to every rock.
But then pull them up –
Yes, that's all the joy wicked people have;
But God will never abandon the faithful
He will let you laugh and shout again,
but he will bring disgrace on those who hate you,

9.verse_text: How can anyone argue with him? that no one could ever answer. or trample the sea monster's back. who helped Rahab, the sea monster, oppose him. Should I take him to court? Could anyone make him go?
God is so wise and powerful;
Without warning he moves mountains
God sends earthquakes and shakes the ground;
He can keep the sun from rising,
No one helped God spread out the heavens
God hung the stars in the sky – the Great Bear,
We cannot understand the great things he does,
God passes by, but I cannot see him.
He takes what he wants, and no one can stop him;
God's anger is constant. He crushed his enemies
So how can I find words to answer God?
Though I am innocent, all I can do
Yet even then, if he lets me speak,
He sends storms to batter and bruise me
He won't let me get my breath;
Should I try force? Try force on God?
I am innocent and faithful, but my words sound guilty,
When an innocent person suddenly dies,
God gave the world to the wicked.
My days race by, not one of them good.
My life passes like the swiftest boat,
Since I am held guilty, why should I bother?
No soap can wash away my sins.
God throws me into a pit of filth,
If God were human, I could answer him;
But there is no one to step between us –
Stop punishing me, God!
I am not afraid. I am going to talk

10.verse_text: I am tired of living. Listen to my bitter complaint. Tell me! What is the charge against me? To despise what you yourself have made? And then to smile on the schemes of wicked people? and hunt down every fault I have? that no one can save me from you. are you going to crush me back to dust? you made me grow in my mother's womb. and covered the bones with muscles and skin. and your care has kept me alive. you were secretly planning to harm me. so that you could refuse to forgive me. but when I do right, I get no credit. you hunt me down like a lion; to hurt me you even work miracles. your anger towards me grows and grows; you always plan some new attack. I should have died before anyone saw me. would have been as good as never existing. Let me enjoy the time I have left. going to a land that is dark and gloomy, where the light itself is darkness.
Don't condemn me, God.
Is it right for you to be so cruel?
Do you see things as we do?
Is your life as short as ours?
Then why do you track down all my sins
You know that I am not guilty,
Your hands formed and shaped me, and now those same hands destroy me. I am miserable and covered with shame.
Remember that you made me from clay;
You gave my father strength to beget me;
You formed my body with bones and sinews
You have given me life and constant love,
But now I know that all that time
You were watching to see if I would sin,
As soon as I sin, I'm in trouble with you,
If I have any success at all,
You always have some witness against me;
Why, God, did you let me be born?
To go from the womb straight to the grave
Isn't my life almost over? Leave me alone!
I am going soon and will never come back –
a land of darkness, shadows, and confusion,

11.verse_text: Job, do you think we can't answer you?
You claim that what you say is true;
How I wish God would answer you!
He would tell you there are many sides to wisdom;
Can you discover the limits and bounds
The sky is no limit for God,
God's greatness is broader than the earth,
If God arrests you and brings you to trial,
God knows which people are worthless;
Stupid people will start being wise
Put your heart right, Job. Reach out to God.
Put away evil and wrong from your home.
Then face the world again, firm and courageous.
Then all your troubles will fade from your memory,
Your life will be brighter than sunshine at noon,
You will live secure and full of hope;
You won't be afraid of your enemies;
But the wicked will look round in despair

12.verse_text: But I have as much sense as you have;
Even my friends laugh at me now;
You have no troubles, and yet you make fun of me;
But thieves and godless people live in peace,
Even birds and animals have much they could teach you;
ask the creatures of earth and sea for their wisdom.
All of them know that the LORD 's hand made them.
It is God who directs the lives of his creatures;
But just as your tongue enjoys tasting food,
When God tears down, who can rebuild,
Drought comes when God withholds rain;
God is strong and always victorious;
He takes away the wisdom of rulers
He dethrones kings and makes them prisoners;
he humbles priests and men of power.
He silences those who are trusted,
He disgraces those in power
He sends light to places dark as death.
He makes nations strong and great,
He makes their leaders foolish
they grope in the dark and stagger like drunkards.

13.verse_text: But my dispute is with God, not you;
You cover up your ignorance with lies;
Say nothing, and someone may think you are wise!
Listen while I state my case.
Why are you lying?
Are you trying to defend him?
If God looks at you closely, will he find anything good?
Even though your prejudice is hidden,
and his power will fill you with terror.
Your proverbs are as useless as ashes;
Be quiet and give me a chance to speak,
I am ready to risk my life.
I've lost all hope, so what if God kills me?
It may even be that my boldness will save me,
Now listen to my words of explanation.
I am ready to state my case,
Are you coming to accuse me, God?
Let me ask for two things; agree to them,
stop punishing me, and don't crush me with terror.
Speak first, O God, and I will answer.
What are my sins? What wrongs have I done?
Why do you avoid me?
Are you trying to frighten me? I'm nothing but a leaf;
You bring bitter charges against me,
You bind chains on my feet;
As a result, I crumble like rotten wood,

14.verse_text: We are all born weak and helpless. All lead the same short, troubled life. we disappear like shadows. or put me on trial and judge me? from anything as unclean as human beings. the number of months they will live. You have settled it, and it can't be changed. it can come back to life and sprout. and its stump dies in the ground, they die, and where are they then? and lakes that go dry, They will never wake up while the sky endures; they will never stir from their sleep. let me be hidden until your anger is over, and then set a time to remember me. But I will wait for better times, wait till this time of trouble is ended. and you will be pleased with me, your creature. but you will not keep track of my sins. you will wipe out all the wrongs I have done. and solid cliffs are moved away. and heavy rain will wash away the soil; so you destroy our hope for life. his face is twisted in death. nor is he told when they are disgraced. and the grief of his own mind.
We grow and wither as quickly as flowers;
Will you even look at me, God,
Nothing clean can ever come
The length of their lives is decided beforehand –
Look away from them and leave them alone; let them enjoy their hard life – if they can.
There is hope for a tree that has been cut down;
Even though its roots grow old,
with water it will sprout like a young plant.
But people die, and that is the end of them;
Like rivers that stop running,
people die, never to rise.
I wish you would hide me in the world of the dead;
If people die, can they come back to life?
Then you will call, and I will answer,
Then you will watch every step I take,
You will forgive them and put them away;
There comes a time when mountains fall
Water will wear down rocks,
You overpower someone and send him away for ever;
His sons win honour, but he never knows it,
He feels only the pain of his own body

15.verse_text: No wise person would talk as you do
If you had your way, no one would fear God;
Your wickedness is evident by what you say;
There is no need for me to condemn you;
Do you think you were the first person born?
Did you overhear the plans God made?
There is nothing you know that we don't know.
We learnt our wisdom from grey-haired people –
God offers you comfort; why still reject it?
But you are excited and glare at us in anger.
You are angry with God and denounce him.
Can any human being be really pure?
Why, God does not trust even his angels;
And people drink evil as if it were water;
Now listen, Job, to what I know.
Those who are wise have taught me truths
Their land was free from foreigners;
The wicked who oppress others
Voices of terror will scream in their ears,
They have no hope of escaping from darkness,
and vultures are waiting to eat their corpses.
disaster, like a powerful king,
That is the fate of those
They are the ones who captured cities
They will not remain rich for long; Even their shadows will vanish, whose blossoms are blown away by the wind.
and they will not escape from darkness.
If they are foolish enough to trust in evil,
Before their time is up they will wither,
They will be like vines that lose their unripe grapes;
There will be no descendants for godless people,
These are the ones who plan trouble and do evil;

16.verse_text: Are you going to keep on talking for ever?
If you were in my place and I in yours,
I could strengthen you with advice
But nothing I say helps,
You have worn me out, God;
You have seized me; you are my enemy. and people take that as proof of my guilt.
In anger God tears me limb from limb;
People sneer at me;
God has handed me over to evil people.
I was living in peace,
and shoots arrows at me from every side –
He wounds me again and again;
I mourn and wear clothes made of sackcloth,
I have cried until my face is red,
but I am not guilty of any violence,
O Earth, don't hide the wrongs done to me!
There is someone in heaven
My friends scorn me;
I want someone to plead with God for me,
My years are passing now,

17.verse_text: The end of my life is near. I can hardly breathe; there is nothing left for me but the grave. There is no one else to support what I say. don't let them triumph over me now. they come and spit in my face. my arms and legs are as thin as shadows. and they all condemn me as godless. are more and more convinced they are right. I would not find even one of them wise. my hope is gone. they say that light is near, but I know I remain in darkness. where I will lie down to sleep in the dark. and the worms that eat me I will call my mother and my sisters. Who sees any? when I go down to the world of the dead.
I watch how bitterly everyone mocks me.
I am being honest, God. Accept my word.
You have closed their minds to reason;
In the old proverb someone betrays his friends for money, and his children suffer for it.
And now people use this proverb against me;
My grief has almost made me blind;
Those who claim to be honest are shocked,
Those who claim to be respectable
But if all of them came and stood before me,
My days have passed; my plans have failed;
But my friends say night is daylight;
My only hope is the world of the dead,
I will call the grave my father,
Where is there any hope for me?
Hope will not go with me

18.verse_text: What makes you think we are as stupid as cattle?
You are only hurting yourself with your anger.
The light of the wicked will still be put out;
The lamp in their tents will be darkened.
Their steps were firm, but now they stumble;
They walk into a net, and their feet are caught;
a trap catches their heels and holds them.
On the ground a snare is hidden;
All round them terror is waiting;
They used to be rich, but now they go hungry;
A deadly disease spreads over their bodies
They are torn from the tents where they lived secure,
Now anyone may live in their tents – after sulphur is sprinkled to disinfect them!
Their roots and branches are withered and dry.
Their fame is ended at home and abroad;
They will be driven out of the land of the living,
They have no descendants, no survivors.
From east to west, all who hear of their fate
That is the fate of wicked people,

19.verse_text: Time after time you insult me
Even if I have done wrong,
You think you are better than I am,
Can't you see it is God who has done this?
I protest against his violence,
God has blocked the way, and I can't get through;
He has taken away all my wealth
He batters me from every side.
God is angry and rages against me;
He sends his army to attack me;
God has made my own family forsake me;
my relatives and friends are gone.
Those who were guests in my house have forgotten me;
When I call a servant, he doesn't answer –
My wife can't stand the smell of my breath,
Children despise me and laugh when they see me.
My closest friends look at me with disgust;

My skin hangs loose on my bones; I have barely escaped with my life. and write them so that they would last for ever. while still in this body I will see God. so that you will know there is one who judges.
You are my friends! Take pity on me!
Why must you persecute me as God does?
How I wish that someone would remember my words
Or with a chisel carve my words in stone
But I know there is someone in heaven
Even after my skin is eaten by disease,
I will see him with my own eyes,
'How can we torment him?'
But now, be afraid of the sword –

20.verse_text: What you have said is an insult,
Surely you know that from ancient times,
no wicked people have been happy for long.
They may grow great, towering to the sky,
but they will be blown away like dust.
They will vanish like a dream, like a vision at night,
The wicked will disappear from the place where they used to live;
and their children will make good what they stole from the poor.
Their bodies used to be young and vigorous,
But in their stomachs the food turns bitter,
The wicked vomit up the wealth they stole;
What evil people swallow is like poison;
They will not live to see rivers of olive oil
They will have to give up all they have worked for;
because they oppressed and neglected the poor
Their greed is never satisfied.
When they eat, there is nothing left over,
At the height of their success
Let them eat all they want!
When they try to escape from an iron sword,
Arrows stick through their bodies;
Everything they have saved is destroyed;
Heaven reveals their sin,
All their wealth will be destroyed
This is the fate of the wicked,

21.verse_text: Give me a chance to speak and then,
My quarrel is not with mortals;
Look at me. Isn't that enough
When I think of what has happened to me,
Why does God let evil people live,
They have children and grandchildren,
God does not bring disaster on their homes;
Yes, all their cattle breed
Their children run and play like lambs
and dance to the music of harps and flutes.
They live out their lives in peace
The wicked tell God to leave them alone;
They think there is no need to serve God
They claim they succeed by their own strength,
Was a wicked person's light ever put out?
and blow them away like straw in the wind,
You claim God punishes a child for the sins of his father.
Let sinners bear their own punishment;
When our lives are over,
Can anyone teach God,
Others have no happiness at all;
But all alike die and are buried;
I know what spiteful thoughts you have.
You ask, 'Where are the houses of great people now,
Haven't you talked with people who travel?
On the day God is angry and punishes,
There is no one to accuse the wicked
When they are carried to the graveyard,
thousands join the funeral procession,
And you! You try to comfort me with nonsense!

22.verse_text: Does your doing right benefit God,
It is not because you stand in awe of God
No, it's because you have sinned so much;
To make your brother repay you the money he owed,
You refused water to those who were tired,
You used your power and your position
You not only refused to help widows,
So now there are pitfalls all round you,
It has grown so dark that you cannot see,
Doesn't God live in the highest heavens
And yet you ask, 'What does God know?
You think the thick clouds keep him from seeing,
Are you determined to walk in the paths
Even before their time had come,
These are the ones who rejected God
And yet it was God who made them prosperous –
Good people are glad and the innocent laugh
All that the wicked own is destroyed,
Now, Job, make peace with God
Accept the teaching he gives;
Yes, you must humbly return to God
Throw away your gold;
Let Almighty God be your gold,
Then you will always trust in God
When you pray, he will answer you,
You will succeed in all you do,
God brings down the proud
He will rescue you if you are innocent, if what you do is right.

23.verse_text: How I wish I knew where to find him,
I would state my case before him
I want to know what he would say
Would God use all his strength against me?
I am honest; I could reason with God; he would declare me innocent once and for all.
I have searched in the east, but God is not there;
God has been at work in the north and the south,
Yet God knows every step I take;
I follow faithfully the road he chooses,
I always do what God commands;
He never changes. No one can oppose him
He will fulfil what he has planned for me;
I tremble with fear before him.

The scales on his belly are like jagged pieces of pottery;
He churns up the sea like boiling water
He leaves a shining path behind him
There is nothing on earth to compare with him;
He looks down on even the proudest animals;

42.verse_text: Then Job answered the LORD . that you can do everything you want. when I am so very ignorant. I talked about things I did not understand, about marvels too great for me to know. and to try to answer your questions. but now I have seen you with my own eyes. and repent in dust and ashes.
I know, LORD , that you are all-powerful;
You ask how I dare question your wisdom
You told me to listen while you spoke
In the past I knew only what others had told me,
So I am ashamed of all I have said
After the LORD had finished speaking to Job, he said to Eliphaz, 'I am angry with you and your two friends, because you did not speak the truth about me, as my servant Job did.

Now take seven bulls and seven rams to Job and offer them as a sacrifice for yourselves. Job will pray for you, and I will answer his prayer and not disgrace you as you deserve. You did not speak the truth about me as he did.'
Eliphaz, Bildad, and Zophar did what the LORD had told them to do, and the LORD answered Job's prayer.
Then, after Job had prayed for his three friends, the LORD made him prosperous again and gave him twice as much as he had had before.

All Job's brothers and sisters and former friends came to visit him and feasted with him in his house. They expressed their sympathy and comforted him for all the troubles the LORD had brought on him. Each of them gave him some money and a gold ring.
The LORD blessed the last part of Job's life even more than he had blessed the first. Job owned 14,000 sheep, 6,000 camels, 2,000 head of cattle, and 1,000 donkeys.
He was the father of seven sons and three daughters.
He called the eldest daughter Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the youngest Keren Happuch.
There were no other women in the whole world as beautiful as Job's daughters. Their father gave them a share of the inheritance along with their brothers.
Job lived 140 years after this, long enough to see his grandchildren and great-grandchildren.
And then he died at a very great age.
